page.title: 08TRANSPORT IN WOODSPRING
page.content: The private moter car is essential for coming and going in the village.Young people often ride motorbikes or bicycles.This can make essential trips to shops or doctors very difficult for the elderly or very young who cannot drive.The community spirit in villages,however, means that lifts are nearly always available. Wick St. Lawrence has a bus on Tuesdays and Thursdays, which makes one trip to Weston Super Mare and returns.It is a private coach subsid- ised by the local authority. The M5 motorway built in the 1960's skirts the edge of Wick St. Lawrence. the nearest access and exit point is at St.Georges about 1\ miles away. In the first half of the twentieth century a light railway ran from Weston Super Mare to Clevedon with halts in both villages.
